article_title: PolitiFact N.J.: Barbara Buono says Rutgers tuition is up 10 percent since Chris Christie's been governor
article_text:
When it comes to sure things in New Jersey, rising college tuition just might be a safe bet.

And to hear the claims of a recent gubernatorial campaign ad from Barbara Buono's camp, tuition at Rutgers University has increased 10 percent since Chris Christie has been governor.

Buono (D-Middlesex) is challenging Christie, a Republican, in the Nov. 5 governor's race.

How did the state senator's claim fare on the Truth-O-Meter? Is the 10 percent figure accurate and is Christie to blame for the hike? Find out at PolitiFactNJ.com and then join the conversation about our ruling at NJ.com.

You also can follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

More Truth-O-Meter Rulings:

• PolitiFact N.J.: NJEA ad claims politicians cut more than $1 billion from education

• PolitiFact N.J.: Cory Booker supports late-term abortion, opposes safety regulations, groups claim
